artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Hirookaya Kōsuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 296; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 295.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three sheets; battlefield scene with building at left; two men with guns at left--one man points with his PL hand, with blood on his head and sashes; bleeding men in LLC and middle foreground; three men in LRC--two with guns; water in middle ground at center and right; men and horses in background at center and right; black sky; fires at right
dimension: 13 5/8 × 10 in. (34.61 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 応需大蘇芳年 {ōju Taiso Yoshitoshi}
title: Picture of the Battle of Shimotoba at Fushimi in Yamashiro Province
